aboutSection.subtitle: Get to know me
aboutSection.title: About Me
aboutSection.description: I'm a software engenieer currently based in Costa Rica. My background is Computer Science, but in 2019 I took the Artificial Intelligenc course and had to come up with a project, we had an AWS DeepRacer but I didn't want to rely on AWS credits to train the reinforcement learning model so I c

softwareEngineer.title: Software Engineer
softwareEngineer.subtitle: Software Engineer @ EY (2021 - 2023)
softwareEngineer.description1: As a Software Engineer at EY, I engaged in designing and developing software solutions, focusing on blockchain-based applications and optimizing web app performance.
softwareEngineer.description2: I was involved in the entire development cycle of blockchain-powered applications, from architectural design to full-stack development, ensuring robust backend functionality and intuitive frontend experiences.

machineLearning.title: Machine Learning
machineLearning.subtitle: Coca-Cola
machineLearning.description1: I have been immersed in machine learning for approximately five years, with a keen focus on the engineering aspects as well. My recent projects at Coca-Cola include leading initiatives to enhance data matching accuracy through efficient retrieval techniques, utilizing both dense and sparse vectors, and implementing VectorDBs.
machineLearning.description2: I am also involved in deploying models for consumption, particularly in environments with limited computing resources such as CPUs, ensuring efficient and scalable AI solutions.

personal.title: Personal
personal.subtitle: A brief history
personal.description1: Based in Costa Rica, I began my AI journey in 2019 with an AWS DeepRacer project. Instead of sticking to AWS credits, I pushed myself by training my own CNN model, inspired by NVIDIA’s work on self-driving cars.
personal.description2: That project sparked my passion for deep learning. Since then, I’ve taken courses like Stanford’s CS231n and used machine learning in all my projects, especially focusing on technologies like Transformers. My goal is simple: improve a little every day. Most of my work has been local, but I'm looking to contribute more to open-source projects soon.

projectsSection.subtitle: Something I'm proud of
projectsSection.title: Projects
projectsSection.description: I'm improving my documentation efforts. I will be sharing detailed documentation of my projects and experiences to provide insight into my work. Stay tuned for working demos and, if possible, video recordings to get a better understanding of my projects.

projects.title: Seizure Classification
projects.description: American Epilepsy Society Seizure Prediction Challenge, which consists in predicting seizures in intracranial EEG recordings. Particularly, we compared how a Visual Transformer (ViT) performed to other Machine Learning methods like Convolutional Neural Networks, Support Vector Machines, and Random Forest

projects.title: Vehicle Counting
projects.description: Built a system for real-time vehicle counting on video footage. We used YOLOv4 as our object detector and plugged in different trackers from the OpenCV Multitracker library and DeepSort. We compared how these trackers performed in different challenging road scenarios.

projects.title: Speech Recognition Evaluation
projects.description: Recollected and labeled (Label Studio) audio from the Costa Rica Legislative Assembly Youtube channel. Evaluated how different open source Transformer models performed on the dataset after being finetuned in Spanish from Costa Rica

projects.title: Robot Assistant
projects.description: Developed a perception and control system which can find and deliver certain objects in a room. This was done using QiBullet simulation and based on YOLO v4.

projects.title: Personal website
projects.description: You are looking at it right now.

contactSection.title: Get in touch
contactSection.description: I'm always open to discussing new projects, creative ideas, or opportunities to be part of your vision.
